user_name.hint: Name the character should refer you as.

character_name.hint: Name of the character to load.

context.hint: Additional persistant context to send to the text generation model. This will have a great impact on the output.

paused.hint: Keeps track of if the program should be paused or not.

voice_input.hint: Allows input via the microphone using the chosen Speech-To-Text provider.

push_to_talk.hint: Press Right Ctrl to record audio from the microphone, release to end recording. Requires 'Voice Input' to be on.

read_live_chat.hint: Makes the character respond to live chat messages.

read_chat_after_x_seconds.hint: Time in seconds to wait for before reading the next chat message.

chat_reading_mode.hint:
[Latest-Buffered]: Reads the latest chat message, if none is found reads next (older) message in a buffer of 4 messages. If buffer is empty, tries to monologue.
[Latest]: Reads the latest chat message, if none is found tries to monolgue.
[All]: Reads every chat message without exception.

always_read_highlighted.hint: Highlighted messages will not be skipped and will be prioritized over other chat messages. (Might only work on Twitch)

monologue.hint: Make the character talk about subjects of interest if no new chat messages have been found.

monologue_chance_percent.hint: Modify the probability of triggering a monologue when no other input sources are available.

additional_logs.hint: Displays debug-related logs in the console.

log_to_file.hint: Write console contents to a file in the logs folder.

max_short_term_memory_entries.hint: Number of interactions to keep in memory. A greater number might disolve the character's personality and lead to repetition and incoherent speech.

contextual_memories.hint: Memories to be remembered based on context (i.e if encounters keyword)

value.content: w-AI-fu (or ai waifu) is an open-source program written in the languagesh TypeScript and Python used to create and run customized AI Vtubers. It was created by w-AI-fu_DEV (aka DEV). It is the program currently running.

filter_bad_words.hint: Checks the content of the character's speech for bad words.

blacklisted_chatters.hint: Lowercase usernames of chatters the character should not respond to. Usually used for bots. Or for people you don't really like.

livestream_platform.hint: What platform from which to receive messages and events.

voice_input_device.hint: Audio device from which to receive input, usually a microphone.

tts_output_device.hint: Audio device on which to play the TTS for the character.

narrator_tts_output_device.hint: Audio device on which to play the TTS for the narrator.

alt_output_device.hint: Audio device on which to play audio unrelated to TTS. Used for the instrumental track of songs.

volume_modifier_db.hint: Modifies the volume of the TTS. Unit is dB.

use_narrator_to_read_chat.hint: Use another voice when reading a message coming from live chat.

narrator_voice.hint: Voice seed of the TTS for the narrator.

api_port.hint: Port of the VTS instance's plugin API.

full_reset_hotkey_sequence.hint: Hotkey sequence to call once connecting to VTS. Usually used to reset the animations and toggles.

emotions.hint: Hotkey sequences to play for each emotions. Emotions are infered using the LLM for each answers. Make sure the name of the emotion is related to a feeling the character will express in its response.
